snippet: The Korean electronics giant estimated quarterly profit of $8.3 billion, short of analysts’ expectations, as sales of Galaxy S4 smartphones slowed.
abstract: Samsung Electronics says it expects weaker profit and revenue, attributed to slowing sales of high-end smartphones in trend that also bedevils main rival Apple; company expects to post operating profit of 9.5 trillion won, or $8.3 billion, for second quarter, up 47 percent from year earlier.
lead_paragraph: The Korean electronics giant estimated quarterly profit of $8.3 billion, short of analysts’ expectations, as sales of Galaxy S4 smartphones slowed.

headline.main: Samsung Cuts Its Forecast as Sales Growth Slows for Its Costliest Smartphones
headline.print_headline: Samsung Cuts Its Forecast as Sales Growth Slows for Its Costliest Smartphones
